title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Monday 30 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: police seek party-goers as girl , 16 , falls critically ill .
cumbrian rally team lifts world championships .
ulverston teenager celebrates part in world cup win .

documents.title: through the day : bbc cumbria live
text: we 've now finished posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and other items that catch our eye for today .
here 's a reminder :
if there 's something that should be here such as a story or photo you 've taken in the county , let us know by sending an email , on facebook or on twitter .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cloud increasing through the night
text: there 'll be clear spells this evening but cloud will increase through the night with outbreaks of rain spreading eastwards .
there 'll be gentle winds and a minimum temperature of 7 deg c ( 45 deg f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: terry 's cumbrian sunrise gets cheer from the alps
text: cumbrian filmmaker and photographer terry abraham tweeted a few of the first perfect frosty sunrise of the winter from his home and collected the social media equivalent of a round of applause from the alps .
good morning folks !
nice frost in the # edenvalley today # cumbria @ twitterid @ twitterid
amazing ! !
awesome ! !
einfach wunderschön ! !
sorry , that 's my own language i 'm really fascinated from your

documents.title: water firm lays on shuttle bus as main road is closed
text: united utilities say contractors will work round the clock to try to minimise the length of time a main road near keswick is closed .
the a591 through dodd wood is being shut off to allow a new water main to be laid as part of a £ 300m scheme to supply west cumbria from thirlmere .
the road 's used by many people from the town to get to the a595 towards north cumbria and carlisle , or for people from the bothel area to get to keswick .
john hilton from united utilities says the company 's doing its best to help local people deal with the inevitable inconvenience .
we 've also put a shuttle bus on for locals in the are to shuttle them round to the normal bus routes . ''

documents.title: penrith businesses to vote on continuing `` bid '' scheme
text: businesses in penrith will start voting this weekend on whether to continue paying extra rates into a fund used to improve trade in the town .
so far the business improvement district scheme has generated more than £ 130,000 a year , with the money being spent on branding and events such as the winter droving festival .
heidi marshall , who is president of the town 's chamber of trade , said : `` the bid is having a positive impact on people 's impressions of penrith and that can only be good for business . ''

documents.title: travel : shed load slows southbounders at shap on m6
text: a shed load has partly blocked the m6 southbound at junction 39 ( shap ) on the mp
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : long rail delays into scotland
text: a broken rail has brought delays of up to 90 minutes on transpennine trains between carlisle and edinburgh .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: motorway cash administrator stole £ 27,000 , court told
text: a motorway services administrator who helped himself to more than £ 27,000 in takings has been given a suspended 12 month prison sentence and ordered to pay the money back .

when he appeared at carlisle crown court today , charles jack riley , 29 , of bridgeside , carnforth , admitted theft from roadchef 's killington services between june 2015 and august 2016 , sometimes taking more than £ 100 a time by changing records of takings at a mcdonald 's restaurant .
the court was told his crime happened when he had issues including `` alcohol consumption , gambling and poor financial management . ''
riley said he would repay the money using home equity .

documents.title: marathon athletes conquer top fells challenge
text: about 2,000 runners spent two days circling the lake district 's highest peaks at the weekend , suffering the worst it could throw at them and enjoying the best .

the original mountain marathon takes place in a different upland area every autumn , partly in the hope of adding bad weather to the challenge and on saturday low cloud and rain made navigation between 140 checkpoints difficult .
many of the competitors camp out on the hills , as they have to carry everything they need to survive 36 hours in the outdoors , but there 's a site for those who want it .
and on sunday the athletes found themselves running into the base camp in great langdale in near perfect sunshine .

the 50th event in the series had attracted teams from 30 countries including japan and australia , and the success contrasted with the last visit to the lake district in 2008 , when floods caused some dramatic difficulties .
this time mountain rescue teams dealt only with two minor injuries .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: driver in death crash denies 'danger ' charge
text: a driver who crashed into two highways england traffic officers on the m6 , killing one and leaving the other paralysed , has gone on trial at carlisle crown court .
peter morrison , 37 , of the warke , worsley , manchester , has admitted careless driving , but denies dangerous driving , in february 2016 .
the court was told that before the crash , mr morrison had averaged 81mph , and just before the collision he 'd been sending and receiving text messages .
on the motorway just south of tebay , a 50mph speed limit was in force with overhead gantry warnings of an accident and the weather was bad , with heavy rain and strong winds .

mr morrison told police he 'd lost control as if he was `` on ice '' , with his car veering from the third lane to the hard shoulder where it hit the two , killing adam gibb and leaving paul holyroyd paralysed from the chest down .
the trial continues .

documents.title: landowners call for migrants work scheme after brexit
text: there 's a warning that parts of cumbria 's farming industry could be badly hit by the uk 's departure from the european union , if an easy way to bring migrant workers into the country is n't established .
the country land and business association says the industry is already struggling to recruit enough workers and relies heavily on those from other countries .
it wants the government to reintroduce a seasonal agricultural workers scheme , which would allow migrants of eu and non-eu countries to enter the uk for a set period of time and for a specific job .

documents.title: teenager still seriously ill after barrow party
text: a teenager from barrow remains seriously ill in intensive care in hospital after a house party , but the police say her condition has now improved from being critically ill .
the 16-year-old fell ill after the party on holbeck park avenue on saturday .
it 's not yet know what caused this but the police were investigating a possible drug or alcohol link , and detectives have thanked those people who came forward with more information .
author: Neil Smith
South Cumbria journalist, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: quick off the mark at water speed records week
text: it 's coniston water speed records week , with powerboat racers aiming to set new records in various classes ranging from the fairly slow , to well over the 100mph mark .
and perfect weather has meant the perfect start to the 47th annual event .
1st run of the week .
endija zumane has set a new world record at 60.85mph in gt30 class .

documents.title: travel : queues through roadworks on a591 near windermere
text: there are queues on the a591 between windermere and staveley where temporary traffic lights are operating for roadworks .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : a591 closes for six weeks for pipeline work
text: the a591 north west of keswick has closed for about six weeks for work laying a major water main .
diversions are via the a66 .
the pipeline is to take water supplies from thirlmere to west cumbria , and less is abstracted from ennerdale for environmental reasons .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: wales triumph takes cumbrian rally firm to glory
text: m-sport cars took first and third place in the wales rally and the company slotted into top spot in the fia wrc constructors ' championship at the weekend .
elfyn evans and daniel barritt came home in first place and sebastien ogier and julien ingrassia were third in the fiestas designed and built in cockermouth .
it means m-sport hold the world rally championships for drivers , co-drivers and manufacturers .
it really was the triple crown , and a very emotional day for all of us . ''

documents.title: still no date for flood-hit homeless hostel to reopen
text: carlisle city council says it still ca n't say when one of its hostel for homeless men will be reopened , nearly two years after it was closed because of flood damage .
carlisle city council had hoped that the john street hostel on shaddongate would reopen 'within months ' at the end of 2015 , but the opening date has been put back a number of times .
since then alternative housing 's been found so the council can carry of fuflilling its legal duties to homeless people .
now councillors say only a final few touches , and recruiting staff to cover round the clock shifts , are needed before it can reopen , but they still ca n't give a date .
the contractors are dealing with snagging and there 's some electrical works and stuff like that to do ; we 're also coming to the end of a recruitment process for staffing there . ''

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cold but mainly dry
text: it 'll be a cold afternoon but mainly dry and bright with hazy sunny spells .
temperatures will only make 10c ( 50f ) at best .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police seek two after garage thefts
text: police investigating thefts from two car dealerships in carlisle have released of two men they would like to speak to .
an exhaust system was stolen from border toyota on parkhouse road , and seven car batteries taken from carlisle audi on kingstown broadway in 45 minutes at lunchtime on 23 october .

documents.title: more than 2,000 runners race over fells in two day marathon
text: more than 2,000 runners took part in the original mountain marathon at the weekend , running two long courses across the fells from great langdale over two days .
competitors had to navigate various routes , with checkpoints , over courses of varying difficulty .
two competitors were helped by mountain rescue teams .

keswick volunteers stretchered one man who turned an ankle near high white stones , down langstrath to an ambulance , and langdale ambleside members took another competitor down from cold pike with a shoulder injury .

documents.title: bishop of penrith to retire
text: the bishop of penrith , the right reverend robert freeman , says he will be retiring next easter .
bishop robert , who moved to join the carlisle diocese in 2011 , say that as he 's turning 65 , `` it seems a good time to explore the next phase of life '' .

documents.title: travel : roadworks slow traffic on a66
text: the traffic 's very slow on the a66 at kirby thore , through the roadworks .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: army bomb squad still working at sellafield
text: staff at sellafield say the army explosives disposal team is still busy helping the firm deal with old supplies of solvents found in a laboratory .
the company says the safest way of destroying the chemicals is with a controlled explosion and this may be audible off the site .

documents.title: curtis helps take england 17s to world cup championship
text: ulverston 's curtis anderson played in goal as england won 5-2 against spain in the under-17 world cup final at the weekend .
we 're still all buzzing from the actual game , never mind we 've just won the tournament , but then it starts to sink in , we 're all just very proud to do it . ''
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: you first frost on the fields below blencathra
text: staff at the blencathra field studies centre were celebrating the first real frost of the winter this morning , and here 's why .

text: temperatures at 3,000ft : 2c .

cloud : fells will be fog-free .
visibility : generally good .
freezing level : 2,300-3,000ft this morning , above the summits this afternoon

documents.title: travel : water main work slows traffic on a65
text: the a65 burton road in kendal has temporary traffic lights until wednesday for water main work .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cold start to a clear day
text: it 'll be a cold start with a widespread frost , leading into a dry day with bright or sunny spells , light westerly winds and a maximum temperature of just 10c ( 50f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police seek partygoers as girl falls critically ill
text: police are trying to find out how a 16-year-old girl fell critically ill after a house party in barrow .
officers believe at least 13 other teenagers were at the party and are still trying to trace some of them .
the teenager was taken to the intensive care unit at the furness general hospital in a critical condition early on sunday following the party at holbeck park avenue .
police say they do not know what made the girl ill , but they are looking at the possibility that it could be alcohol or drugs related .

documents.title: good morning and welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: we 'll be posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and other good things through until about 18:00 .
